page.title: 19GALA DAY IN SOUTH EDINBURGH
page.content: Prestonfield Gala is a happy{community {event}held each June and which involves many local people.It originated from a street party which celebrated the end of World War II in 1945.The first Gala was held in 1946.The Gala court consists of the Queen,her ladies in waiting,maids of honour,train bearers,courtiers and crown bearer.Originally the Dux of {Prestonfield School}was the Gala Queen,but now it is a popular local lass.During gala week there are activities for all ages,e.g. sports,tugs of war, football, basketball, art competitions, majorette marching, barbeque,discos but all culminating on the final day,Saturday.On that day there is a {procession}which winds round the streets of Prestonfield,coming to a halt in the school playground.
